content.question: A wavelength of <math alttext="510 nanometers" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>510</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>nm</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> corresponds to an approximate frequency of <math alttext="6 times 10 to the power 14, per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>6</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>14</mn></mrow></msup><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msup><mrow><mtext>s</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>. What is the approximate energy of one photon of this light?

choices.label: <math alttext="9 times 10 to the power 47, Joules" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>9</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>47</mn></mrow></msup><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>J</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="3 times 10 to the power 17, Joules" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>17</mn></mrow></msup><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>J</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="5 times 10 to the power negative 7, Joule" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>5</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>7</mn></mrow></msup><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>J</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="4 times 10 to the power negative 19, Joule" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>4</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>19</mn></mrow></msup><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>J</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="4 times 10 to the power negative 19, Joule" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>4</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>19</mn></mrow></msup><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>J</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 5.F: Calculate, estimate, or predict an unknown quantity from known quantities by selecting and following a logical computational pathway and attending to precision (e.g., performing dimensional analysis and attending to significant figures).
